page.title: 10LANDSCAPE _ RURAL WILTSHIRE
page.content: This landscape is designated "an area of outstanding natural beauty". It is chalk downland, changing with the seasons as it is mostly agricultural land. It is hilly, without deep valleys, more undulating than steep inclines and descents. From high vantage points a patchwork of fields with occasional small copses of trees can be seen. The farmhouses are surrounded by outbuildings - open barns (Dutch) seem to be the most usual; these being somewhat newer. The older barns are open-ended with weatherproof sides. Amongst a variety of small buildings are pig sties, chicken houses and runs, dove cotes and stables for horses. Only one main B road cuts through this area with a small section of the M4 motorway across the top right hand corner.
